title: Problemas al conectar Thunderbird a cuentas de Office 365 utilizando POP3 y autenticación OAuth2
content:
Hola,

Recientemente he encontrado problemas al conectar Thunderbird a varias de mis cuentas de correo de Office 365 utilizando POP3 y autenticación OAuth2.

Hace poco, Microsoft anunció la deshabilitación de la autenticación básica, dando preferencia a la autenticación moderna. Estoy utilizando OAuth2 en Thunderbird, el cual entiendo que se clasifica como una forma de autenticación moderna. A pesar de tener configurada correctamente la autenticación OAuth2 en Thunderbird, continúo enfrentando dificultades.

El error que recibo al intentar conectar mis cuentas de Office 365 a Thunderbird es: "El comando STAT no se completó con éxito. Error al obtener el número de mensajes y sus tamaños. El servidor de correo outlook.office365.com respondió: Server Unavailable. 21". Este problema solo se presenta en algunas cuentas de Office 365, mientras que otras cuentas similares funcionan sin inconvenientes. Para ser más preciso, en una computadora con 6 cuentas configuradas, solo 2 de ellas presentan el problema. He buscado diferencias a nivel de servidor (licencias, claves, etc.) entre estas cuentas y no encuentro ninguna. Son idénticas tanto en la configuración del cliente como del servidor.

Es importante mencionar que todo funcionaba a la perfección hasta la mañana de ayer. Tras contactar a Microsoft, me informaron que ya no admiten POP, lo cual me resulta confuso ya que, según tengo entendido, aún debería ser posible usar POP con autenticación moderna (OAuth2).

Estoy utilizando la última versión de Thunderbird y he verificado mi configuración de autenticación para asegurarme de que OAuth2 está correctamente establecido. También intenté configurar mi cuenta con IMAP en lugar de POP, pero sin éxito.

Estoy en busca de aclaraciones y posibles soluciones a este problema. ¿Alguien tiene alguna idea de por qué esto podría estar sucediendo y cómo podría resolverlo? Además, me gustaría plantear la pregunta: ¿Será que a partir de ahora todos estaremos obligados a utilizar Exchange?

Agradezco de antemano su ayuda.
creator: josebarrosdasilva

title: Issues connecting Thunderbird to Office 365 accounts using POP3 and OAuth2 authentication
content:
I have recently encountered issues connecting Thunderbird to several of my Office 365 email accounts using POP3 and OAuth2 authentication.

Recently, Microsoft announced the deprecation of basic authentication in favor of modern authentication. I am using OAuth2 in Thunderbird, which I understand qualifies as a form of modern authentication. Despite having correctly configured OAuth2 authentication in Thunderbird, I continue to face difficulties.

The error I receive when attempting to connect my Office 365 accounts to Thunderbird is: "The STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. The mail server outlook.office365.com responded: Server Unavailable. 21". This issue only occurs with some of my Office 365 accounts, while other similar accounts work without any problems. Specifically, on a computer with 6 configured accounts, only 2 of them experience this issue. I have searched for differences at the server level (licenses, keys, etc.) between these accounts and found none. They are identical in both client and server configuration.

It is important to note that everything was working perfectly until yesterday morning. After contacting Microsoft, I was informed that they no longer support POP, which confuses me as I understood that it should still be possible to use POP with modern authentication (OAuth2).

I am using the latest version of Thunderbird, and I have verified my authentication settings to ensure that OAuth2 is correctly set up. I have also attempted to configure my account with IMAP instead of POP, but without success.

I am seeking clarification and possible solutions to this problem. Does anyone have any ideas why this might be happening and how I could resolve it? Additionally, I would like to pose the question: Will we all be required to use Exchange from now on?

I appreciate any assistance in advance.
creator: josebarrosdasilva

title: I need to copy my TBird address book from my desktop PC to my laptop.

title: Authentication error with Yahoo mail (one account fine, another not)
content:
Similar to an earlier post (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1398079), I have been using TB to connect to yahoo accounts without issue for years, but about a month ago one of two yahoo email accounts failed. Since one of the accounts still works without issue, not clear what's going on?

Ubuntu 22.04 Thunderbird 102.11.0 (64-bit)

I think perhaps it's the email account add / configuration step for several reasons. Let's call the account that works "A" and the not-working broken account "B". Early on, I deleted the "B" account and have since been trying to get this to work again. During the "add account" step, I've let TB configure automatically, which yields the same server info as "A", so I don't think that's an issue; The settings that show up when attempting to add "B" (same as "A") are in a screenshot. After you click "Done", there's a pop up to get Yahoo's password. I enter this, then click yes to the agreement, and *immediately* get the authentication error (another screenshot). The speed of this error is what has me suspicious. It made me think some local files somehow have incorrect info. I tried clearing history ("everything") and restarting, but same story.

Unfortunately, the earlier question doesn't have an answer. Any more clues about this?

Thanks in advance
